org.infiniquery.service

Class DefaultQueryModelService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.infiniquery.service.DefaultQueryModelService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QueryModelService

    public class DefaultQueryModelService
extends java.lang.Object
implements QueryModelService
    Service empowering the interaction of above layers (e.g. frontend or MVC controllers) with the infiniquery model.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Doboga

        Execute a query against the database.
        Specified by:
        executeQuery in interface QueryModelService
        Parameters:
        executableQuery - an instance of ExecutableQuery which needs to have filled in (at least) the logical dimension.
        Returns:

      • compileQuery

        public java.lang.String compileQuery(ExecutableQuery executableQuery)
        Description copied from interface: QueryModelService
        Compiles a query and returns it, translated into the query language supported by the underlying persistence layer.
        Specified by:
        compileQuery in interface QueryModelService
        Parameters:
        executableQuery - an instance of ExecutableQuery which needs to have filled in (at least) the logical dimension.
        Returns:
        The compiled query, as String, expressed into the query language supported by the underlying persistence layer.

      • registerSecurityService

        public void registerSecurityService(SecurityService securityService)
        Register a security service with this query model service. For example, you can register your own implementation of SecurityService to tell it how to determine the role of the current logged user. If this method is not used to register a custom security service, the default security service will be used, which always allows the maximum access rights to any user.
        Specified by:
        registerSecurityService in interface QueryModelService
        Parameters:
        securityService - the security service to register

      • reloadQueryContext

        public void reloadQueryContext()
        Description copied from interface: QueryModelService
        Reload the query context configuration. This operation should be triggered when we want to change the query settings at runtime.
        Specified by:
        reloadQueryContext in interface QueryModelService
